Job Position: HSE Coordinator

Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Provides field HSE support and guidance throughout all activities.
	Compliance:
	
		Ensure compliance with local regulatory HSE requirements.
		Ensure compliance with contract HSE requirements.
	
	
	Assists in the development and delivery of Operational Processes safely.
	Enforces company policies and procedures.
	Assists teams to deliver an exemplary HSE performance.
	Performance Measurement:
	
		Identifies potential and actual areas of improvement and assists in setting and formulating goals and tools for their achievement;
		Provides input to leading and lagging HSE performance measures;
	
	
	Liaises with all stakeholders in order to be aware and educate the workforce on HSE news &amp; updates.
	Lessons Learnt:
	
		Provides input to the collection of Lessons Learnt for all activities;
	
	
	Hazard Identification and Risk Assessment:&nbsp;Assists teams in identifying hazards, assessing risks, and identifying relevant controls to manage and reduce these risks to ALARP;
	Fosters a safe culture by being informed, mindful, learning, fair and respectful.
	Behaviour Based Safety (BBS):
	
		Owns BBS tools and processes;
		Promotes and coaches the workforce in Behavioral Based Safety;
	
	
	Assurance:
	
		Perform audits to measure the level of safety culture;
		Carries out or facilitates safety audits and inspections as per audit plan;
		Provides HSE input to HSE Management System Reviews;
	
	
	Incident Management:
	
		Ensures Incidents are recorded &amp; reported;
		Prepares initial incident reports;
		Carries out immediate Incident &amp; Near Miss investigation;
		Facilitates &amp; participates in High-Level Incident investigations;
	
	
	Training &amp; Coaching:
	
		Ensures that the company safety expectations are communicated to the workforce;
		Provides training sessions as per Training Plan &amp; Competency development requirements;
		Educates workforce on Lessons Learnt from previous &amp; industry incidents;
	
	
	Contingency Management:
	
		Provide immediate response in emergency situations;
		Reviews contingency drills to maintain and increase staff competency;
		To assist in setting up an effective emergency response organization on site;
	
	
	Training &amp; Coaching:&nbsp;Coaches teams on HSE and conducts HSE engagement sessions with them;
	Environment:
	
		Measures required environmental parameters;
		Ensures Waste Segregation is observed;
	
	
	Working Environment:&nbsp;Carry out and follow up on workplace assessments;
	Quality Control:&nbsp;Monitor the quality of data entered in the reporting &amp; action tracking tools;
	Contractor Management:&nbsp;Manages contractor and consultants in all aspects of health and safety;
	Document control.


Qualifications


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree with 10 - 14 years of work experience.
	Maintains full awareness of all existing applicable legislative and assurance requirements.


Soft Skills:


	Demonstrates Safety leadership.


Computer Literacy:


	Microsoft Office
	SAP, complimentary.
	Action Tracking Software.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;fafolabi13@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

        Nigeria Sinotruck Limited is a commercial automotive company that is interested in starting a vendor leasing desk.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: HSE Coordinator

Job Location: Sagamu, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Provides field HSE support and guidance throughout all activities.
	Compliance:
	
		Ensure compliance with local regulatory HSE requirements.
		Ensure compliance with contract HSE requirements.
	
	
	Assists in the development and delivery of Operational Processes safely.
	Enforces company policies and procedures.
	Assists teams to deliver an exemplary HSE performance.
	Performance Measurement:
	
		Identifies potential and actual areas of improvement and assists in setting and formulating goals and tools for their achievement;
		Provides input to leading and lagging HSE performance measures;
	
	
	Liaises with all stakeholders in order to be aware and educate the workforce on HSE news & updates.
	Lessons Learnt:
	
		Provides input to the collection of Lessons Learnt for all activities;
	
	
	Hazard Identification and Risk Assessment: Assists teams in identifying hazards, assessing risks, and identifying relevant controls to manage and reduce these risks to ALARP;
	Fosters a safe culture by being informed, mindful, learning, fair and respectful.
	Behaviour Based Safety (BBS):
	
		Owns BBS tools and processes;
		Promotes and coaches the workforce in Behavioral Based Safety;
	
	
	Assurance:
	
		Perform audits to measure the level of safety culture;
		Carries out or facilitates safety audits and inspections as per audit plan;
		Provides HSE input to HSE Management System Reviews;
	
	
	Incident Management:
	
		Ensures Incidents are recorded & reported;
		Prepares initial incident reports;
		Carries out immediate Incident & Near Miss investigation;
		Facilitates & participates in High-Level Incident investigations;
	
	
	Training & Coaching:
	
		Ensures that the company safety expectations are communicated to the workforce;
		Provides training sessions as per Training Plan & Competency development requirements;
		Educates workforce on Lessons Learnt from previous & industry incidents;
	
	
	Contingency Management:
	
		Provide immediate response in emergency situations;
		Reviews contingency drills to maintain and increase staff competency;
		To assist in setting up an effective emergency response organization on site;
	
	
	Training & Coaching: Coaches teams on HSE and conducts HSE engagement sessions with them;
	Environment:
	
		Measures required environmental parameters;
		Ensures Waste Segregation is observed;
	
	
	Working Environment: Carry out and follow up on workplace assessments;
	Quality Control: Monitor the quality of data entered in the reporting & action tracking tools;
	Contractor Management: Manages contractor and consultants in all aspects of health and safety;
	Document control.


Qualifications


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor’s Degree with 10 - 14 years of work experience.
	Maintains full awareness of all existing applicable legislative and assurance requirements.


Soft Skills:


	Demonstrates Safety leadership.


Computer Literacy:


	Microsoft Office
	SAP, complimentary.
	Action Tracking Software.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: fafolabi13@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

  "description": "Elin Group Limited is a growing privately owned Energy conglomerate with diverse business interest in Real Estate development, Power Generation, Agricultural development, Gas Utilization, Mining Operations, Maritime and the Aviation sector. We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Content Creator / Social Media Handler

Job Location:&nbsp;Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	Are you a creative thinker with a flair for storytelling and digital media?
	Do you have a way with words and a passion for creating engaging content that captivates and converts?
	Join our dynamic team as a Content Creator/ Social Media Handler and help shape the voice and visuals of our brand across multiple platforms.


Role Overview


	As our Content Creator/Social Media Handler, you will be responsible for developing high-quality written and visual content that aligns with our brand identity, engages our target audience, and supports our marketing goals.
	You&rsquo;ll work closely with the brand team to brainstorm, produce, and optimize content for web, social media, campaigns, and more.


Core Responsibilities


	Write compelling blog articles, website blog management, product descriptions, email campaigns, and more.
	Develop and schedule engaging content across platforms like Instagram, LinkedIn, Facebook, and TikTok.
	Create short-form video scripts, carousels, reels, and infographics that align with brand messaging.
	Conduct research to generate content ideas and maintain brand consistency.
	Collaborate with design and marketing teams on content strategy and campaign planning.
	Optimize written content for SEO, readability, and audience engagement.
	Monitor content performance and adapt strategies based on insights and analytics.
	Stay updated on digital trends, platform updates, and audience behavior.

	Proven experience as a content creator, copywriter, or similar role.
	Excellent command of written English and a keen eye for detail.
	Ability to create and edit visual content using tools like Canva, CapCut, or Adobe Suite.
	Familiarity with content management systems (e.g., WordPress), SEO tools, and social platforms.
	Creative mindset with the ability to tell stories across various media formats.
	Strong organizational and communication skills.


Basic knowledge of analytics tools (Google Analytics, Meta Insights) is a plus:


	Design: Canva, Adobe Illustrator, Photoshop, Figma
	Video Editing: CapCut, Adobe Premiere Rush, InShot

	Writing &amp; CMS: Google Docs, Grammarly, WordPress, Notion

	Analytics: Google Analytics, Meta Insights, LinkedIn Analytics
	SEO Tools: Ubersuggest, Yoast, SEMrush (basic)


Bonus if you have:


	Experience with short-form video content (Reels, TikToks).
	Work experience in a corporate organization
	Understanding of email marketing tools like Mailchimp.
	Ability to manage multiple social media accounts or communities.

Content Creator / Social Media Handler Job at Elin Group Limited




        
    

        
        Elin Group Limited is a growing privately owned Energy conglomerate with diverse business interest in Real Estate development, Power Generation, Agricultural development, Gas Utilization, Mining Operations, Maritime and the Aviation sector. Headquartered in Nigeria with footprints across the West African sub-region and the United States of America, our portfolio of investment is consistently purposed to deliver sustainable value to our stakeholders.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Content Creator / Social Media Handler

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	Are you a creative thinker with a flair for storytelling and digital media?
	Do you have a way with words and a passion for creating engaging content that captivates and converts?
	Join our dynamic team as a Content Creator/ Social Media Handler and help shape the voice and visuals of our brand across multiple platforms.


Role Overview


	As our Content Creator/Social Media Handler, you will be responsible for developing high-quality written and visual content that aligns with our brand identity, engages our target audience, and supports our marketing goals.
	You’ll work closely with the brand team to brainstorm, produce, and optimize content for web, social media, campaigns, and more.


Core Responsibilities


	Write compelling blog articles, website blog management, product descriptions, email campaigns, and more.
	Develop and schedule engaging content across platforms like Instagram, LinkedIn, Facebook, and TikTok.
	Create short-form video scripts, carousels, reels, and infographics that align with brand messaging.
	Conduct research to generate content ideas and maintain brand consistency.
	Collaborate with design and marketing teams on content strategy and campaign planning.
	Optimize written content for SEO, readability, and audience engagement.
	Monitor content performance and adapt strategies based on insights and analytics.
	Stay updated on digital trends, platform updates, and audience behavior.


Required Skills & Qualifications


	Proven experience as a content creator, copywriter, or similar role.
	Excellent command of written English and a keen eye for detail.
	Ability to create and edit visual content using tools like Canva, CapCut, or Adobe Suite.
	Familiarity with content management systems (e.g., WordPress), SEO tools, and social platforms.
	Creative mindset with the ability to tell stories across various media formats.
	Strong organizational and communication skills.


Basic knowledge of analytics tools (Google Analytics, Meta Insights) is a plus:


	Design: Canva, Adobe Illustrator, Photoshop, Figma
	Video Editing: CapCut, Adobe Premiere Rush, InShot
	Social Media Management: Meta Business Suite, Buffer, Hootsuite, Later
	Writing & CMS: Google Docs, Grammarly, WordPress, Notion
	Email Marketing: Mailchimp, Brevo (formerly Sendinblue)
	Analytics: Google Analytics, Meta Insights, LinkedIn Analytics
	SEO Tools: Ubersuggest, Yoast, SEMrush (basic)


Bonus if you have:


	Experience with short-form video content (Reels, TikToks).
	Work experience in a corporate organization
	Understanding of email marketing tools like Mailchimp.
	Ability to manage multiple social media accounts or communities.

Inventory Assistant Officer Job at Maxitech Global Investment Limited




        
    

        
        Maxitech Global Investment Limited is a Nigerian ICT distributor established in 2011, offering innovative IT solutions including hardware sales, system integration, and broadband services to enterprises across Nigeria. At Maxitech Global, we offer a wide range of IT products such as computers, laptops, and gadgets at the most affordable prices in Nigeria. We believe that you deserve only the best, so come and visit us today to make a purchase.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Inventory Assistant Officer
Job Location: Lagos 
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Manage and maintain accurate inventory records.
	Conduct regular stock counts and audits to ensure accuracy.
	Monitor stock levels and initiate replenishment orders.
	Coordinate with various departments to fulfill stock requests promptly.
	Ensure compliance with established inventory management procedures.
	Generate comprehensive reports on inventory status and discrepancies.
	Contribute to the continuous improvement of inventory control processes.


Qualifications


	Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration or any related field.
	Proven experience as an Inventory Officer with 2-3 years of relevant work experience.
	Strong analytical and mathematical skills.
	Proficiency in using inventory management software.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
	Detail-oriented with the ability to multitask effectively.
	Must be able to make you of a bin card effectively
	Must have worked in a tech space and be able to identify and differentiate products by serial number and part numbers
	Must be willing to resume work immediately.
	Must be ready to resume Immediately.


Salary
N110,000 - N150,000 Monthly. 

Method of Application
Interested candidates should send their resume and a cover letter detailing their relevant experience to: victor.alofe@maxitechglobal.com using the Job Position as the subject 0f the email.
